oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Jim Horn - 2017-02-25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of Jim Horn from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 25, 2017. Includes audio from video and selected audio excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Horn;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (12:46) Opening comments from Bill Lloyd and recognition of previous Nashville Cats in attendance / (15:21) Audio from video / (17:37) Introduction of Jim Horn / (18:19) Early days growing up in Compton California / (19:00) Being called and job to play sax with Duane Eddy / (19:44) Working with Duane at the Alan Freed Easter Week show in New York and being coached by King Curtis / (22:20) Family background in music and his musical aspirations / (23:18) Working with saxophonist Plas Johnson / (23:50) Taking lessons and learning to read music / (25:20) First professional gig at 16 years old at a night club / (26:33) Working with the Blue Notes band / (27:22) More on working with Duane Eddy and the hesitation from his parents / (28:32) Bill reads note from Duane Eddy about Jim with comments from Jim about working in the early days and traveling on a Greyhound tour bus / (29:32) Story about introducing himself to James Brown /

(30:49) More about King Curtis helping him and his former use of plastic reeds / (31:37) More about working with Duane / (32:04) Excerpts of Duane Eddy recordings featuring Jim Horn on sax and flute / (34:14) Jim with comment about his playing style as a teenager / (34:45) Excerpts of Kip Tyler and the Flips 1958 recording of Rumble Rock and She's My Witch / (37:00) Playing recording sessions with Elvis Presley / (38:44) Elvis karate story about breaking wood planks and Elvis' love of musical jamming / (40:13) Story about appearing in the Elvis movie Girls, Girls, Girls / (41:48) Excerpt of audio from video of the Elvis movie Roustabout / (43:39) Beginning to play more sessions and playing flute with Canned Heat on their recording Going Up The Country / (44:50) Working with Brian Wilson and the Beach Boys / (45:28) Story about Brian trying to learn to play the theremin / (46:28) Story about playing with Frank Sinatra /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Horn, Jim, 1940-; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
